newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco sets cautious 5.0 pct GDP target for 1997.
newsitem.headline: Morocco sets cautious 5.0 pct GDP target for 1997.

text.p: Moroccan Finance Minister Mohamed Kabbaj said on Wednesday Morocco had set a prudent target of five percent growth in Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for 1997.
This compared to a 10 to 11 percent forecast for 1996 and took account of the unpredictable climate affecting farm exports.
Kabbaj told Reuters in an interview that Rabat expected inflation of 4.5 percent for 1996 against 6.1 percent for 1995.

He forecast a budget deficit of below three percent of GDP for the budget year (July 1996 to June 1997) against 5.3 percent for the calendar year 1995, and a current account deficit of 2.0 percent for fiscal 1996/97 against 4.8 pct in calendar 1995.
The Moroccan government changed the fiscal year to run from July to June in a referendum last year.
